cyclone.name: KATIA
cyclone.current_location: about 200 miles E of Tampico, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift little overnight, then turn southwest toward the northern Veracruz coast of Mexico late Friday into early Saturday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Veracruz coast (near Cabo Rojo–Laguna Verde, MX)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cabo Rojo to Laguna Verde, Mexico (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect (warnings expected Thursday for Mexican coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central-northern Veracruz and far southern Tamaulipas coasts of Mexico
weather_observation.wind: Only a 4% cumulative chance of sustained 34-kt winds; any gusts would be brief and mainly late Friday into early Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Texas coast; surge threat limited to Mexican coastline well south of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Fringe showers possible; heavy rain totals (5–10 in) confined to northern Veracruz. Significant rainfall not expected at Brownsville.
weather_observation.other_hazards: None anticipated that would disrupt port operations.
